summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to meet with former President Donald Trump at the White House, accompanied by European leaders, heads of NATO, and the European Commission. This high-profile meeting aims to discuss a peace deal to end the ongoing war in Ukraine, which began with Russia's full-scale invasion in 2022. The meeting underscores the international effort to secure peace in the region, with US security guarantees also in focus as Trump suggests Kyiv could end the war "almost immediately."

title: Trump to Host Zelenskyy, EU Leaders for Talks Amid Pressure on Ukraine Deal
snippets: President Trump will host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy today at the White House. And, more National Guard troops head to Washington, D.C. for the president's crime crackdown.
US president ramps up pressure on Ukrainian leader to accept deal with Russia ahead of talks in Washington, DC.

After US President Trump claimed Kyiv could end the war "almost immediately," Ukrainian President Zelenskyy replied it's up to Russia to stop the fighting. Trump will host Zelenskyy along with several European leaders.
titles: Trump and Zelenskyy to discuss end of war. And, more troops head to D.C.
Trump says Ukraine’s Zelenskyy could end war ‘almost immediately’
Ukraine: 'Russia must end' war it started, Zelenskyy says
summary: President Trump is set to host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and several European leaders at the White House to discuss the ongoing conflict with Russia. Ahead of the talks, Trump has increased pressure on Zelenskyy to accept a deal with Russia, claiming Kyiv could quickly end the war. However, Zelenskyy maintains that the resolution depends on Russia ceasing its aggression. Concurrently, additional National Guard troops are being deployed to Washington, D.C., as part of Trump's crime crackdown initiative.

title: US Open Mixed Doubles Revamp Draws Stars; $1M Prize Announced
snippets: The US Open mixed doubles tournament has a new look, with huge names and prize money.

• Britons to meet in first round of 16-pair event

  • Raducanu and Alcaraz will play Draper and Pegula

Jack Draper and Emma Raducanu, will face each other in the first round of the revamped US Open mixed doubles. The event has been moved to before the main tournam

Grand Slam singles champions such as Jannik Sinner, Carlos Alcaraz, Iga Swiatek and Madison Keys will be playing for a little extra money — OK, a lot of extra money, by any standard: $1 million to the winning duo — and trying to get their hands on a trophy in the U.S. Open’s overhauled mixe
titles: Everything to know about the revamped -- and controversial -- US Open mixed doubles

Revamped US Open mixed doubles format causes stir among tennis stars
summary: The US Open mixed doubles tournament has been revamped, featuring prominent players like Emma Raducanu, Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner, Iga Swiatek, and Madison Keys. In the first round, Britons Raducanu and Jack Draper will compete against each other, paired with Alcaraz and Jessica Pegula, respectively. The event, now positioned before the main tournament, offers a significant prize of $1 million to the winning duo, attracting Grand Slam singles champions to participate.

title: Cambridge Dictionary Adds 6,000 New Words, Showcasing TikTok Influence
snippets: More than 6,000 new terms feature, including some relating to remote working and rich tech giants.
The latest additions to the world's largest online dictionary, among 6,000 others, show how much internet culture is changing the English language.

LONDON (AP) — What the skibidi is happening to the English language? “Skibidi” is one of the slang terms popularized by social media that are among more than 6,000 additions this year to the Cambridge Dictionary. “Internet culture is changing the English language and the effect is fascinating to obs

'Skibidi', 'delulu', and 'tradwife' make their way into Cambridge Dictionary
Cambridge Dictionary adds ‘skibidi’ and ‘tradwife’ among 6,000 new words
summary: The Cambridge Dictionary has added over 6,000 new terms, reflecting the significant influence of the TikTok generation on the English language. Among the new entries are words related to remote working, tech giants, and terms like "skibidi", "tradwife", and "delulu". This update highlights the evolving nature of language and the impact of digital culture.

title: Newsmax Settles Dominion Lawsuit for $67M Over Election Fraud Claims
snippets: The right-wing news channel Newsmax has agreed to pay $67 million to Dominion Voting Systems over its coverage of the 2020 presidential election. A trial had been scheduled for October.
The multimillion-dollar settlement came as President Donald Trump continued to make false claims about voting machine fraud.
titles: Newsmax pays $67 million to settle defamation case linked to 2020 election coverage
Newsmax Settles With Dominion Voting Systems—Owes $67 Million For Claiming 2020 Election Fraud
summary: Newsmax agreed to pay Dominion Voting Systems $67 million to settle a lawsuit concerning its coverage of the 2020 presidential election. This settlement was reached ahead of a scheduled October trial. The lawsuit was related to false claims about voting machine fraud, which have been continuously promoted by former President Donald Trump.

title: Air Canada to Resume Flights Amid Ongoing Strike, 100K+ Passengers Stranded
snippets: Air Canada said it would delay its plans to restart operations to Monday evening. Some 100,000 people have been stranded amid flight cancellations.
The decision by the union representing the 10,000 workers means that travel chaos will continue for at least a second day. Air Canada said it had suspended its reopening plan until Monday evening.
Union ordered to return members to work by noon today
titles: Air Canada strike: Cabin crew defy return to work order
Air Canada Flight Attendants Say They Will Defy Back-to-Work Order
Air Canada says labour board has declared flight attendants strike ‘unlawful’
summary: Air Canada announced plans to resume flights on Monday evening after a strike by flight attendants, represented by CUPE, led to widespread cancellations, affecting around 130,000 passengers daily. The union has defied a federal back-to-work order, challenging its legality and continuing strikes for better wages, causing significant travel disruptions. This defiance comes despite Air Canada’s attempt to restart operations, leaving over 100,000 people stranded. The situation remains unresolved as the union and Air Canada navigate the ongoing dispute.

title: Auburn to Retire Cam Newton's No. 2 Jersey on Oct 11

Newton, who led Auburn to a perfect 14-0 season and the 2010 BCS National Championship, will have his No. 2 jersey retired on Oct. 11
titles: Auburn to retire Cam Newton's No. 2 jersey
Auburn to retire Cam Newton's No. 2 jersey: Tigers to honor Heisman winner, 2010 national champion in October
summary: Auburn University will retire Cam Newton's No. 2 jersey on October 11 during the game against Georgia. Newton, a Heisman Trophy winner, led Auburn to a 14-0 season and the 2010 BCS National Championship. The retirement ceremony honors his contributions to the team.

summary: Mariners outfielder Victor Robles, on a rehab assignment with Triple-A Tacoma, was ejected from a game in Las Vegas for throwing his bat at pitcher Joey Estes after nearly being hit by a pitch. Robles is rehabilitating a shoulder injury incurred in April.

This directive, issued by CIRB vice-chairperson Jennifer Webster, mandates the union's leadership to instruct its members to return to work immediately.

summary: Julian Sayin has been named Ohio State's starting quarterback for the 2025 season opener against Texas, as announced by coach Ryan Day. Sayin, who transferred from Alabama last season, secured the position after a competitive selection process that started in the spring, outperforming Lincoln Kienholz. This decision positions Sayin at the forefront as the Buckeyes, the reigning national champions, prepare for their highly anticipated first game of the season.

title: Danish Firm Cuts Ozempic Price; Stock Rises

summary: Danish pharmaceutical company announced a reduction in the price of Ozempic, a diabetes medication, to $499 per month for three dose sizes for patients without insurance. This pricing is available through the company's direct-to-consumer pharmacy and GoodRx, among other platforms. Following this announcement, the company's stock price increased.

title: Spain Battles Record Wildfires with Military Aid
snippets:
Extreme temperatures exacerbated by carbon pollution fuel fires in southern Europe as green policies are rolled back

  • Europe live –

Thousands of firefighters backed by soldiers and water-bombing aircraft on Monday battled over 20 major wildfires raging across western Spain, where officials say a record area of land has already been burned.
titles: Wildfires rage in Spain and Portugal amid searing heat
Deadly wildfires rage across Spain as record area of land burnt
summary: Thousands of firefighters, supported by soldiers and water-bombing aircraft, are combating over 20 major wildfires in western Spain. Officials report a record area of land has been burned, with extreme temperatures and carbon pollution exacerbating the situation. This development comes amid a rollback of green policies in southern Europe.

title: Trump Suggests Zelenskyy Can End War, Rules Out Crimea Return
snippets: In a post on Truth Social, Trump said that Zelenskyy could "end the war with Russia almost immediately, if he wants to, or he can continue to fight."

titles: Trump puts onus on Zelenskyy to end conflict with Russia ahead of meeting

summary: Former President Donald Trump suggested on Truth Social that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy could quickly end the war with Russia if he chose to, implying a choice between seeking peace or continuing the conflict. Meanwhile, Zelenskyy, preparing for a meeting in Washington D.C. with Trump and European leaders, stated that "the war must be ended," signaling his intention to find a resolution. Additionally, Trump has publicly ruled out the possibility of Ukraine reclaiming Crimea in the context of negotiations or conflict resolution.

title: UCLA Engineers Develop AI System to Detect Wildfire Fuels from Space

titles: Iran's nature is under threat—here's how better environmental stewardship can save it
summary: Iran's diverse landscapes, from deserts to forests, support a rich biodiversity, including over 8,000 plant species, nearly 500 bird species, and 194 mammals. The UN has recognized 13 of its ecological areas for special attention, highlighting the country's significant natural heritage.

This indicates a need for improved technology to support future space exploration.

title: Aircraft Wastewater May Help Track Superbugs, Study Suggests
snippets: Wastewater from aircraft toilets could provide a critical warning system for the global spread of antimicrobial resistant (AMR) superbugs, a silent pandemic that threatens to kill more people than cancer by 2050.
titles: Aircraft toilets could flush out spread of global superbugs
summary: Researchers suggest that analyzing wastewater from aircraft toilets may serve as an early warning system for tracking the spread of antimicrobial resistant (AMR) superbugs. These pathogens pose a significant global health threat, with projections indicating they could cause more deaths than cancer by 2050. This approach could help in monitoring and potentially controlling the spread of these dangerous microbes.

title: Wealth Disclosure Linked to Increased Charity by Rich, Study Finds
snippets: Richer individuals contribute more to the public good when forced to be transparent about their wealth—especially when they can be penalized for financial secrecy, a new study finds.
titles: Openness about wealth combined with penalties for financial secrecy can create fairer societies
summary: A recent study suggests that wealthy individuals tend to contribute more to the public good when they are required to disclose their wealth and can face penalties for financial secrecy. This transparency measure appears to encourage richer individuals to give back more to society.
